definition: cliché/commonplace/truism/stereotype
surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale
old variant of 詞|词[ci2]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
overflowing/excessive/indiscriminate
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: It is tempting to dismiss this trite formulation as a meaningless excuse for inaction.
sentences.chinese: 这种陈词滥调很容易被嗤为不作为的空洞借口。

sentences.english: But the president seems to actually believe his cliches .
sentences.chinese: 但是总统似乎真的相信了他的陈词滥调。

sentences.english: I know it's a cornball thing.
I knew that my fantasized images were poor clichés.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我那些幻想的景象都是些可怜的陈词滥调。

sentences.english: The thing about true out-of-the-box thinkers is they d never use this cliche.
sentences.chinese: 真正的创新思想家是不会说出这句陈词滥调的。

sentences.english: A lot of the cliches in the media are very  false about it.
sentences.chinese: 媒体中很多陈词滥调都对这个问题存在误解。

sentences.english: His spare style defined American modernism, and his life made machismo a cliché.
sentences.chinese: 空暇界定美国现代风格，他的一生作了主义陈词滥调。

sentences.english: His article is stuffed with shibboleth.
sentences.chinese: 他的文章中满是一些陈词滥调。

sentences.english: I am tired of listening to his truisms.
sentences.chinese: 我听腻了他的陈词滥调。

sentences.english: Written down, these are platitudes, but the effect on the spot is revelatory.
sentences.chinese: 有些文字纯属陈词滥调，但置身当场却能给人以启示。

sentences.english: Apart from its 10-out-of-10 rating on the Legendary Clich scale, this sentence makes no sense.
sentences.chinese: 除了是百分百的陈词滥调外，这句话没有一点意义。

sentences.english: These phrases were worn out ten years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这些词语十年前就是陈词滥调了。

sentences.english: And when it comes to providing emotional support, he says, skip the platitudes.
sentences.chinese: 当说到提供情感支持时，他说，略过那些个陈词滥调。

sentences.english: It sounds cliche, but this is a biggie.
sentences.chinese: 听起来是陈词滥调，但是这是一个大问题。

sentences.english: I know it is cliche, but how often do you stop to do it?
sentences.chinese: 我知道这是陈词滥调，但是你有多久没做了？

sentences.english: DeKnight: In a cliche, apparently everybody.
sentences.chinese: 这是陈词滥调了，当然是面向所有人。

definition: hackneyed talk/platitude
(of a writing etc) to have no substance (idiom)/to carry no weight
empty words/bogus speech
to play the same old tune (idiom); unoriginal
officialese/red tape
long-winded empty talk
empty cave, nothing there (idiom); devoid of substance/nothing new to show
to talk nonsense (idiom)/frivolous talk
(of a text) very lengthy (idiom)
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
to moan about imaginary illness/fussing like a hypochondriac/fig. sentimental nonsense
lit. to wave around one's bookbag (idiom)/fig. to show off one's erudition/a person who does so
grandiose but impractical (idiom)/large but of no real use
political correctness/politically correct
argument/view (sometimes derogatory)
clichéd/tacky
